page.title: 06SHUGBOROUGH PARK FARM
page.content: Shugborough Park Farm is being restored as a museum of agriculture, displaying farm machinery and local historic breeds of livestock. The workers at the farm are members of the Rare Breed Society. This means that they can keep and breed rare animals that are dying out. The main Staffordshire animals are the Tamworth pigs and Baggot goats. There are also Longhorn cattle, White Park cattle, Shropshire and Southdown sheep, Gloucester Black Spots (pigs), rabbits and ducks such as Crested white, Black luger and common mallard. There are also two horses, Kitty and Alfie. Alfie is a retired police horse, 31 years old (the oldest animal on the farm). Upstairs you can see bees making honey and some 2-3 week old chicks and turkey eggs in an incubator.
